message.content:
cs.AR, cs.CV, cs.DC, cs.NE, cs.SY. 

The paper focuses on optimizing the performance of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) through efficient use of memory bandwidth, which is a key concern in computer architecture and system design. The paper discusses techniques for partitioning compute units and asynchronous use of them to smoothen the total memory access traffic size over time, which can lead to improved performance. This topic is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including cs.AR (Hardware Architecture), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Among these, cs.AR and cs.CV are the most likely sub-categories, as the paper specifically focuses on optimizing CNNs, which are widely used in computer vision applications and require specialized hardware architectures for efficient processing.
